com.vector.cfg.util.text.mixedtext

Interface IMixedText


  • @PublishedApi(value=ADDITIONS_ALLOWED)
public interface IMixedText
    IMixedText is a construct that represents a text, whereby parts of that text can also hold the object which they represent. This allows a consumer e.g. a GUI to make the object-parts of the text clickable and to reformat these object-parts as wanted.
    Consumers which don't need these advanced features can just call IMixedText#toString() which returns a default format of the text.
    See also IMixedTextBuilder

    (c) Copyright Vctr Informatik GmbH. All Rights Reserved.

    • Method Detail

      • getContainedObjects

        @KeepSecretFromPublishedApi
java.lang.Iterable<java.lang.Object> getContainedObjects()
        Returns all Object, which are contained in this IMixedText.
        Returns:
        the contained objects

      • getFormattedParts

        @PublishedMethod
java.util.Collection<IMixedTextPart> getFormattedParts(IFormatSpec spec)
        getFormattedParts() will return a collection of IMixedTextPart. From any MixedTextPart one can get at least a plain String. Depending on what getPartType() returns, the MixedTextPart supports further interfaces from package com.vector.cfg.business.mixedtext.parts to get access to the contained objects. One can use a MixedText.newObjectResolver() to get different text formatting of any object type (e.g. for ToolTips).

      • getFormattedText

        @PublishedMethod
java.lang.String getFormattedText(IFormatSpec spec)
        getFormatedText() returns a simple concatenation of the parts returned by getFormattedParts().

      • getMixedTextParts

        @KeepSecretFromPublishedApi
java.util.Collection<IMixedTextPart> getMixedTextParts()
